Return a list of decompressed values for the given compressed value. The given value can be assumed to be valid, but not necessarily non-empty.

property media

Media for a multiwidget is the combination of all media of the subwidgets.

Given a dictionary of data and this widget’s name, return the value of this widget or None if it’s not provided.

class users.forms.UserForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.utils.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=None, empty_permitted=False, instance=None, use_required_attribute=None, renderer=None)[source]

Bases: django.forms.models.ModelForm

This class inherits from Django’s forms and provides a form for users to register themselves in the database

Parameters

  • username (str) – This variable stores the username of the user, which is unique for each user

  • email (str) – This variable stores the email address of the user

  • password (str) – This variable stores the password for the user to login

clean()[source]

Hook for doing any extra form-wide cleaning after Field.clean() has been called on every field. Any ValidationError raised by this method will not be associated with a particular field; it will have a special-case association with the field named ‘__all__’.

users.models module

class users.models.UserProfile(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

This model contains all the information and fields of the data of the user we are storing.

Parameters

  • user (models.User) – This helps in matching our model to the pre defined User Django model.

  • user_name (str) – This variable stores the user name of the user we are storing

  • identity (str) – This variable stores the identity i.e. whether the user is a student or a teacher

  • courses_registered (list(users.models.courses)) – This variable stores all the courses for which this user is registered

  • full_name (str) – This variable stores the full name of the user

  • roll_no (str) – This variable stores the roll number of the user

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

IDENTITY_CHOICE = (('teacher', 'teacher'), ('student', 'student'), ('assistant', 'assistant'))
exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

courses_registered

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

class users.models.assignments(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

This model contains all the information and fields of data associated with assignments which we are storing.

Parameters

  • assignmentfile (models.FileField) – This variable stores the assignment file uploaded by the teacher

  • Treestructure (models.FileField) – This variable stores the tree structure file that is supposed to be matched by the user for .zip and .tgz files

  • title (str) – This variable stores the title of the assignment file uploaded by the teacher

  • deadline (models.DateTimeField) – This variable stores the deadline of the assignment to be submitted

  • s (list(users.models.studentsubmissions)) – This variable stores all the information about the submissions made by students to this assignment

  • upload_type (str) – This variable stores the acceptable file/folder format type(extension) of the student submission.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

FILE_TYPES = (('.zip', '.zip'), ('.tgz', '.tgz'), ('.cpp', '.cpp'), ('.py', '.py'), ('.pdf', '.pdf'), ('.sh', '.sh'))
exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

Treestructure

The descriptor for the file attribute on the model instance. Return a FieldFile when accessed so you can write code like:

>>> from myapp.models import MyModel
>>> instance = MyModel.objects.get(pk=1)
>>> instance.file.size

Assign a file object on assignment so you can do:

>>> with open('/path/to/hello.world') as f:
...     instance.file = File(f)
assignmentfile

The descriptor for the file attribute on the model instance. Return a FieldFile when accessed so you can write code like:

>>> from myapp.models import MyModel
>>> instance = MyModel.objects.get(pk=1)
>>> instance.file.size

Assign a file object on assignment so you can do:

>>> with open('/path/to/hello.world') as f:
...     instance.file = File(f)
autograder

The descriptor for the file attribute on the model instance. Return a FieldFile when accessed so you can write code like:

>>> from myapp.models import MyModel
>>> instance = MyModel.objects.get(pk=1)
>>> instance.file.size

Assign a file object on assignment so you can do:

>>> with open('/path/to/hello.world') as f:
...     instance.file = File(f)

class users.models.studentsubmissions(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

This model contains all the information and field of data associated with submissions made by students to various assignments.

Parameters

  • username (str) – This variable contains the username of the student who has made this submission

  • solution (models.FileField) – This variable contains the solution file uploaded by the student

  • file_name (str) – This variable stores the name of the file uploaded by the student

  • feedback (str) – This variable contains the feedback given by teacher(or autograder) to the student for this assignment submission

  • marks (int) – This variable contains the marks given by teacher(or autograder) to the student for this assignment submission

  • created_at (models.DateTimeField) – This variable contains the information about the date and time on which the submission was done

  • status (str) – This variable contains the status of the submission(whether it was submitted before deadline or after deadline)

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

users.views module

users.views.all_submissions(request, num1, num2)[source]

This view shows the teacher all the latest submissions made to the particular assignment by every student.

It searches for all the submissions made to that assignment and maintains a dictionary of the users and their corresponding latest submissions by checking for the upload time and date of the solution and sends this list by passing it as a context to render request so that the uploaded file, marks and other details can be displayed on the html page.

It is also able to take in data from feedback form (defined in forms.py) so that the teacher has the ability to individually update the marks of every assignment.

This view also allows the teacher to download all the submission made by students in a single zip folder.

If the user is a student it simply redirects it to his home page.

Parameters

  • request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object which contains the metadata about the request

  • num1 (int) – id of the course to which the assignment belongs

  • num2 (int) – id of the assignment which we are interested in

Returns

returns the request to render the corresponding html pages

users.views.allcourses_views(request)[source]

This view allows the user to view all the courses he has been enrolled to.

It takes the current user from the request and get all the course he has been enrolled to from UserProfile model and renders it in the html page by sending it as a context. If the user is not authorized, it simply redirects the user to the login page. :param request: HttpRequest object which contains the metadata about the request :type request: HttpRequest :return: returns the request to render the corresponding html pages

users.views.assignment_views(request, num)[source]

This view allows the user to view all the assignments of the course he has been enrolled to by sending the context and rendering it on the html page.

It searchs for the course which have id = num and view all the assignments in that course.

Parameters

  • num (int) – id of the course we are searching the assignments for

  • request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object which contains the metadata about the request

Returns

returns the request to render the corresponding html pages

users.views.course_page(request, num)[source]

This view is used to view all the users registered for that course so that they can be displayed on course page when opened by a teacher.

It gets the course which we are currently enquiring from the ‘num’ variable and maintains a list of the students enrolled in that course by searching for the courses students are enrolled in by going through all the students.

It adds the list of students as a context to render request so that it can be displayed on the html page.

If the user is not authorized it simply redirects it to login page.

Parameters

  • num (int) – id of the course we are searching the users for

  • request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object which contains the metadata about the request

Returns

returns the request to render the corresponding html pages

users.views.createassignment(request, num)[source]

This view allows only a teacher to create an assignment in a course to be visible to every student enrolled in that course.

It saves the data in the database taken in from the assignment form declared in forms.py.

Unauthorized users and students are not able to create an assignment and they simply get redirected to login page and home page respectively

Parameters

  • request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object which contains the metadata about the request

  • num (int) – id of the course

Returns

returns the request to render the corresponding html pages

users.views.createcourse(request)[source]

This view allows a teacher to create a course to which students can register and for student to register for a course created by a teacher.

1)If the user is a teacher, then a course code is generated by using the time and date of creation thus causing it to be always unique and a course with a title taken from the form is generated with this code.

This code is used by students to register for this course.

2)If the user is a student, then it takes the course code from the course_reg form and enrolls that particular student to that course if a course with that particular code exists and also adds the course to students course lists.

Otherwise, it simply prompts them to refill the form.

Parameters

request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object which contains the metadata about the request

Returns

returns the request to render the corresponding html pages

users.views.delete(request)[source]

This view is used to clean all the messages user recieved till now.

Parameters

request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object which contains the metadata about the request

users.views.deregister_view(request, num, uid)[source]

This view is used to deregister students enrolled in a course by the teacher of that course.

It simply removes the link of a selected student with the specific course for which that view is called.

It then renders the home page of teacher.

Parameters

  • request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object which contains the metadata about the request

  • num (int) – id of the course

  • uid (int) – id of the user getting deregistered

Returns

returns the request to render the corresponding html pages

users.views.export_to_csv(reuest, num1, num2)[source]

This view is used to get all the marks and feedback of each student in a CSV file in a specific format.

It writes the students detail, name of file it uploaded, current marks and current feedback in the CSV file, for each submission made till the time.

It then downloads that CSV file.

Parameters

  • request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object which contains the metadata about the request

  • num1 (int) – id of the course

  • num2 (int) – id of the assignment

Returns

returns the request to render the corresponding html pages

users.views.home(request)[source]

This view is used for rendering the home page of users.

It checks whether the user is logged in or not and also if the user who is logged in is a teacher or a student and renders the corresponding home pages.

If the user is logged out then it simply redirectsthe user to login page.

If the user was a student, it also returns an extra argument context which contains the assignments of the student. The context is used to send the variable names to the templates to display the assignments of the student.

Parameters

request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object which contains the metadata about the request

Returns

returns the request to render the corresponding html pages

users.views.logout_view(request)[source]

This view is used to logout the user from the portal.

Parameters

request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object which contains the metadata about the request

users.views.marks(request, num1, num2)[source]

This view is used to update marks and feedback of all students through a csv file.

It first requires the user with identity as teacher to upload a csv file with a specific format.

It then reads the file and updates the marks and feedback for the latest solutions uploaded by the students till the time.

It redirects the unauthorized users to the login page

Parameters

  • request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object which contains the metadata about the request

  • num1 (int) – id of the course

  • num2 (int) – id of the assignment

Returns

returns the request to render the corresponding html pages

users.views.reg_student(request, num)[source]

This view is used by teachers to register new students to their course with the help of student’s user name and roll number similar to how we are automatically enrolled for courses on moodle.

It works by searching if a student with these user name and roll number exist in the database.

If such student does not exist it will simply ask to refill the form.

But if such student does exist then it searches whether this student has already been enrolled to this course or not.

If no, then it just adds the student to this course.

Parameters

request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object which contains the metadata about the request

Returns

returns the request to render the corresponding html pages

users.views.register_user(request)[source]

This view is used to register a user by taking in data from the registration form.

If the data filled in the form is valid, it adds the user with these details to the database and redirects to login page.

Otherwise if the data filled in the form is invalid, it simply prompts the user to refill the registration form.

Parameters

request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object which contains the metadata about the request

Returns

returns the request to render the corresponding html pages

users.views.sendmsg(request, num1, num2)[source]

This view send message from teacher to the student with id = num2, which contains the code to register for the course with id = num1.

Parameters

  • num1 (int) – id of the course

  • num2 – id of the student

users.views.sendmsgall(request, num1)[source]

This view send message from teacher to all the unregistered students, which contains the code to register for the course with id = num1.

Parameters

  • request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object which contains the metadata about the request

  • num1 (int) – id of the course

users.views.solution_upload(request, num1, num2)[source]

This view is used to upload the solution for each assignment only if the submitted file format match the upload_type specified by the teacher.

As soon as a submission is made, the file format is checked, if its not as specified the users gets a message.

Else if the file type is “.zip” or “.tgz” it runs a subproces to match the tree structure of the uploaded file with the one provided by the teacher for that particular assignment. It then updates the feedback and status of the student’s submission. If the specified file type is “.sh” it spawns a subprocess to evaluate the submission and the marks, status and feedback gets updated automatically for each submission.

It requires the user with identity as student only to make a submission. It redirects the unauthorized users to the login page.

Parameters

  • request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object which contains the metadata about the request

  • num1 (int) – id of the course

  • num2 (int) – id of the assignment

Returns

returns the request to render the corresponding html pages

users.views.time(u)[source]

function which returns deadline of the assignment, which is used to sort the assignments based on their deadline.

Parameters

u (model.assignment) – assignment for which we want deadline

users.views.update(request)[source]

This view is used to update the password of user’s account.

It takes the user to a new page to fill out a password change form and updates the password of the user.

It then redirects the user to the login page for logging in again. :param request: HttpRequest object which contains the metadata about the request :type request: HttpRequest :return: returns the request to render the corresponding html pages
